name: low voltage system production, for Li-ion battery | low voltage system, for Li-ion battery | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24759/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg low voltage system, which is part of the Battery Management System (BMS) of a Li-ion battery. The low voltage system is modelled according to the publication of Ellingsen et al. (2014). It is assumed that the low voltage system is manufactured at an electronic component production plant.;Reference:;Ellingsen, L. A. W., Majeau-Bettez, G., Singh, B., Srivastava, A. K., Valøen, L. O., & Strømman, A. H. (2014). Life cycle assessment of a lithium-ion battery vehicle pack. Journal of Industrial Ecology, 18(1), 113-124.

The activity starts with the electronic and other material entering the factory.

The activity ends with the production of low voltage system at the factory gate.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2014 (year of the publication of data) and 2020 (year of the dataset)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Original data were provided by the battery producer Miljøbil Grenland, located in Norway, for a Li-ion battery for use in electric vehicles. (Ellingsen et al. 2014, Life cycle assessment of a lithium‐ion battery vehicle pack. Journal of Industrial Ecology, 18(1), 113-124). Geography uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The low voltage system is made of nylon clips and wiring harnesses, modeled as a passive electronic component. Injection molding is used as a proxy for manufacture of clips.
